our proper place at the present time in
the evolution of the world and of
humanity in conformity with the past and
future of the earth and of humanity we
are always confronted with this when we
come in touch with any of the old
strivings which we now see illumined by
the soul and the spirit when we climb
the mountains here and find the ancient
druid of memorials which represent the
spiritual striving of olden times they
may be to us a reminder of how those
ancient men strove for the spirit and
looked up in their own way to the coming
Christ and how only then they reached
their fulfillment we too may now again
have a spiritual knowledge gained by
spiritual vision through which we in our
way shall perceive the coming Christ who
must return because he must be perceived
by mankind
his spiritual form the living form in
which he went through the mystery of
Golgotha in this region where such
beautiful old memorials have been
preserved we all feel special gratitude
to those who arranged for our course of
lectures to be given here but I still
wish to add in this respect I shall say
in my farewell speech this evening

you
